{
  "task_id": "BUG-02",
  "summary": "bool coercion is applied inconsistently: `enable_stream` and `parallel_tool_calls` are validated via `coerce_bool_strict`, but the `stream` input itself is not, so non-bool truthy/falsy values can leak into payload and violate expected strict boolean schema.",
  "root_cause": "`build_responses_request` computes `payload[\"stream\"]` using `coerce_bool_strict(...) and stream`, where `stream` is passed through without coercion or strict validation. This creates a gap in bool strictness for a payload boolean field.",
  "minimal_fix_steps": [
    "Apply `coerce_bool_strict` to the `stream` argument in `build_responses_request` before composing payload.",
    "Update stream composition to combine two coerced booleans, e.g. `effective_enable_stream = coerce_bool_strict(..., field_name=\"enable_stream\")` and `effective_stream = coerce_bool_strict(stream, field_name=\"stream\")`, then `payload[\"stream\"] = effective_enable_stream and effective_stream`.",
    "Add targeted tests in `tests/openai_gpt5_responses/test_payloads_bool_coercion.py` for `stream` accepting bool-like values (`True/False`, `\"true\"/\"false\"`, `1/0`) and rejecting non-supported tokens."
  ],
  "regression_tests": [
    "test_stream_accepts_bool_like_values",
    "test_stream_rejects_invalid_bool_text",
    "test_stream_returns_bool_type",
    "run existing `test_parallel_tool_calls_accepts_bool_like_values` and `test_enable_stream_accepts_bool_like_values` for guardrail stability"
  ],
  "evidence": [
    {
      "path": "app/openai_gpt5_responses/internal/payloads.py",
      "quote": "def coerce_bool_strict(value: Any, *, field_name: str) -> bool: ... return bool(value) ... raise ValueError",
      "why_it_matters": "This helper enforces strict boolean-like parsing, so any field expected to be boolean should consistently use it; current gap is where it is not used."
    },
    {
      "path": "app/openai_gpt5_responses/internal/payloads.py",
      "quote": "effective_stream = (\\n        coerce_bool_strict(\\n            params.pop(\"enable_stream\", True), field_name=\"enable_stream\"\\n        )\\n        and stream\\n    )",
      "why_it_matters": "The `stream` operand is used directly here and is not coerced, so non-boolean values can produce a non-boolean payload value even though the schema is boolean."
    },
    {
      "path": "tests/openai_gpt5_responses/test_payloads_bool_coercion.py",
      "quote": "def test_enable_stream_accepts_bool_like_values(... model_parameters={\"enable_stream\": raw}, stream=True, ... )",
      "why_it_matters": "Existing bool tests only cover `enable_stream`/`parallel_tool_calls`/`json_schema.strict`, with no direct coverage for coercion/strictness of the `stream` argument itself."
    }
  ],
  "risk_notes": [
    "Minimal surface-area change; only affects payload construction behavior for invalid `stream` inputs previously accepted implicitly.",
    "If any caller currently passes non-bool values for `stream` intentionally, they will now receive `ValueError` and must be updated.",
    "No behavior change for valid bool input paths."
  ]
}
